body: $ZIM I am back to interpreting the drop in price from early June to early July as hedge funds creating liquidity to get shares.  They did this by aggressively shorting (as high as ~14%
created_at: possibly higher as I didn't check daily).  Since then
column3: the share price has had a controlled ascent with aggressive down mornings to keep momentum from igniting as they attempt to close out their short positions.  If the share price rises too far too fast before they are out of their short positions (still at ~11%)
column4: they will likely try to manufacture some more aggressive down days
column5: though it will be difficult with all the higher earnings revisions and guidances.

Hapag-Lloyd poised for multi-billion-dollar windfall from soaring freight rates
Carrier upgrades earnings forecast this year to between $19.5bn and $21.5bn
28 July 2022 10:05 GMT UPDATED  28 July 2022 10:40 GMT
By Ian Lewis   in    London
Hapag-Lloyd has again massively upgraded its earnings forecast on the back of soaring freight rates.
The world‚Äôs fifth-largest liner company is projecting Ebitda of $19.5bn to $21.5bn this financial year ‚Äî $5bn higher than previously forecast in April.
It also upgraded its Ebit projection to the range of $17.5bn
